node.statement: KEY INEQUALITY. Write T₁=N(v₁)N(w₁), T₂=N(v₂)N(w₂), T₃=N(v₃)N(w₃). The collapsed 2-term cost is N(v₁+αv₃)N(w₁)+N(v₂+βv₃)N(w₂) ≥ 1. We need T₁+T₂+T₃ ≥ 1. By ultrametric: N(v₁+αv₃) ≤ max(N(v₁),|α|N(v₃)), so N(v₁+αv₃)N(w₁) ≤ max(T₁, |α|N(v₃)N(w₁)). The deficit from collapsing is absorbed by T₃ iff T₃ ≥ the amount lost. Formalize this.
